alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 11 at 3:20PM EDT until June 11 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL MIAMI-DADE COUNTY... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the thunderstorms have ended over the warning area. However, between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from the storms. This amount of rainfall will take sometime to drain away due to the grounds being saturated. Therefore, the Flash Flood WArning remains in effect until 4 PM EDT this afternoon. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Miami, Coral Gables, South Miami, Kendall, Pinecrest, Palmetto Bay, Glenvar Heights, Sunset, University Of Miami, Richmond Heights, The Crossings, The Falls, Howard, Palmetto Estates and Three Lakes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
